reviews.text: Had an opportunity to dine with the family/ owners and it was a wholesome experience! They were most hospitable. The food and beverages were amazing, the preparation emaculate, the smiles genuine and the foot traffic - overstood. This place is not luxurious, but that's not of concern. We found it to be a comfy familial atmosphere, with a restroom, fresh cooked meals, and good products - especially the iced Vietnamese coffee. Hands down the best I've ever tasted. We'll be back!

Best Vietnamese BÃ¡nh Mi in New York City and possibly the cheapest.
Other delectable Delicacies for takeaway along with many tasty drinks

Overall great place. Very simple, no frills, but the food is amazing. The Banh mis are thr best ive had and the pork, rice and salas is great as well.

My only wish is that they had some more vegeterian options since apart from the egg banh mi, there is nothing else. The other thing would be accepting card payments. But overall great food, service and prices.

The kitchen creates memorable meals in a clean space. The flavor profiles here worked for me. The decor enhances your meal. The employees here truly care about your experience. Ba XuyÃªn willingly goes above and beyond.

I really love their sandwiches , especially the #1, theyâ€™re packed with fillings and taste amazing! Their pandan cake used to be one of my favorites too.

But lately, both the food quality and service have become inconsistent.

1ï¸âƒ£ I once drove 30 minutes just to get the last pandan cake, but it turned out dense, sunken, and hard â€” clearly a failed batch.
2ï¸âƒ£ The next visit, every single cake on the shelf had sunk in the middle. I couldnâ€™t understand why theyâ€™d still sell those.
3ï¸âƒ£ Another time, I called around 1 PM to check availability. The owner vaguely said there were two left and could hold them, then mentioned the next batch wouldnâ€™t be ready until 5 PM. When I tried to confirm, she hung up on me.

I really regret not taking photos â€” they wouldâ€™ve shown exactly what I mean.
Perfect Banh mi

Had the Chicken Fu bahn mi and it was the best mahn mi I've ever had. Super affordable (big sandwhich 8$, they also had rolls for a dollar). The ladies in here are so sweet and they sell lots of other prepared foods as well. I can't wait to go back for a shake another day !
NYCs best banh mi. Definitely ask for their homemade hot sauce.

I ordered the vegetable and egg bÃ¡nh mÃ¬, and it was absolutely delicious. The bread was perfectly crusty, and the vegetables were so good. My only regret was that I didn't have enough cash on me for a shake (they are a cash-only establishment). I'd definitely recommend giving this place a try!
Amazing sandwiches
The avocado shake was amazing
No frills place. You get more than what you pay for.
Get a banh mi and a drink and be happy

I bought a chicken leg with rice for lunch at this Vietnamese Food Shop today. It is located on 4222 8th Avenue, Brooklyn, New York. It was unbelievable that they did not change the price, it was still $8. è‰¯å¿ƒå°åº— They sell sandwiches, snacks, and sweets too.
Cash only, food is great and the shop gives Asian auntie vibes lol

The aunties and the food here deserve your tips if you can afford it!

Having lived in the neighborhood for a few years, I've really come to appreciate how, thanks to their commitment to keeping prices low, Ba Xuyen is a cornerstone for so many different parts of the community, from old Southern Chinese aunties and uncles catching up to Hispanic workers and English-only newcomers in the neighborhood. The kindness of the workers, the low prices, and the stellar food welcomes everyone. There's two aunties working there in particular who just radiate warmth.

As food goes, plenty has been said about the Banh Mi. But my favorite item is easily the Chicken Rice lunch box. I can't include a photo because I already finished mine. For $8 you get 2-3 meal portion of juicy chicken and fresh veggies with a lovely chili sauce on the side. The best part is the rice: it's lightly marinated in the oils from the chicken in a way that reminds me of Hainanese chicken rice. Except this is half the usual price of Hainanese chicken rice, and double the usual portion.

Also, delicious, delicious 4$ Vietnamese iced coffee. Add $1 tip, since they make it better than your local barista makes their $8 half-size version.

beware: cash-only. Besides that small caveat, easily one of my favorite spots to hit in Sunset Park, having lived here for a little over a year now. Get an extremely filling bahn mi + a perfectly not-too-sweet thai iced tea for $12 and some change.

Perfect place to grab your meal to-go & walk a couple minutes to enjoy it at Sunset Park, overlooking the Manhattan skyline. One of my few frequented meals in the city, always makes the rent a little more bearable knowing I have options like this nearby ğŸ˜®â€ğŸ’¨
Phenomenal

Most amazing and affordable banh mi I have had in the city!! So fresh and filling. I also recommend getting their shakes!! I got the papaya & it was the perfect touch for my meal. They also sale an array of Viet snacks and deserts :) Also make sure to bring cash as they are cash only
The best hidden gem that you must try Banh Mi and Sinh To Bo (avocado smoothie)
Delicious food and coffee and so affordable!
Wow
Great banh mi!

- Ordered their original banh mi sandwich and it tasted great. For me, it isn't as good as the banh mi sandwiches I had at Mr Banh Mi on 86th Street, but just as good as Banh Mi Co Ut in Manhattan Chinatown.
- Iced Coffee and Iced Thai Milk Tea tasted great.
- Very good value.
- Fairly short wait.
- Cash only.
Best place to grab delicious food!
been going here since i was a teenager and it hits every time. absolute favorite and i used to buy the gai luo to snack on back then
Excellent no frills banh mi.  It's the type of sandwich I obsess over.  It's perfect.

Small cash only banh mi shop that offers other vietnamese snacks and appetizers. Cold cut sandwich (#1) was authentic, had a nice balance of veggies + meat and vietnamese coffee was also noteworthy. For the food price and quality, it was worth the visit and deserves a comparison to Thanh Da next time im in the neighborhood.

Best banh mi I had in New York! I also grabbed the avocado shake, papaya shake, pandan cake, banh beo, and mung bean cake. Everything tasted amazing and the folks are so sweet. Definitely would recommend grabbing to go and having a picnic at Sunset Park.

Super legit Vietnamese breakfast and lunch spot. Banh mi  and meat over rice dishes. Great crusty bread, lovely vegetables, and meat/protein options. Feels like aunties running a hole in the wall shop. Great vibes and energy. Affordable, fast, legit.

Went here specifically to try the avocado shake and omg it was so good, creamy and not too sweet. It was reasonably priced at $6, just be aware that this place is cash only. Iâ€™d drive back to this area just for the sake! And the staff was really friendly! Would love to come back and try more.
Great coffee great sandwich
$8 for a somewhat perfect pate and ham sandwich!  I wish I lived closer.

This sandwich shop is truly iconic, with a history spanning over 30 years. Ever since I moved into the neighborhood ten years ago, their menu has remained completely unchangedâ€”a testament to how well-loved it is. They offer eight classic baguette sandwiches, and the pickled carrots inside are marinated in white vinegar, giving them a refreshingly tangy flavor thatâ€™s especially perfect for summer.

One important thing to note: they only accept cash, so make sure to bring some with you if youâ€™re planning to visit.

In the summer, there are also hidden menu items available at the front counter, like spring rolls filled with vermicelli noodles and shrimp. These items arenâ€™t listed on the main menu, but you can just grab them and pay at the counter.

And if youâ€™re lucky, you might spot an â€œoutsideâ€ menu on displayâ€”featuring quick hot meals like fried rice, fried noodles, spring rolls, and shrimp-based dishes. Itâ€™s super casual, fast, and surprisingly flavorful.

If youâ€™re looking to explore the local food scene, this is one spot you absolutely canâ€™t missâ€”a true neighborhood classic.
Super authentic, great bread and fabulous ingredients. My only issue is sometimes the filling is sparse. super great vibes though, you can tell the women there are proud of their work.
Fast and delicious.

Just my favorite sandwich shop around, every time I'm stopping there it's great, never disappoints, and amazing prices.
It was my little secret, check it before the Instagram people will ruined it
Favorite viet bread place. Coconut noodles are really good when you don't know what to eat

202506

æˆ‘å€‘é‚„é»äº†è¶Šå—ç¢—ç²¿banh beo ä¸€ä»½$4 å¥½åƒå¥½åƒ è¶Šå—å’–å•¡ä¸€æ¯$4ä¹Ÿå¾ˆæ¿ƒå¾ˆå¥½å– æ«ƒå°é˜¿å§¨éƒ½å¾ˆè¦ªåˆ‡ å”¯ä¸€å¯ä»¥æŒ‘å‰”çš„å°±æ˜¯åº—è£¡ä½å­ä¸å¤šå¦‚æœå°–å³°æ™‚é–“ä¾†æ‡‰è©²éœ€è¦ç­‰ é‚„æœ‰å¥½é  çœŸå¸Œæœ›é–‹åœ¨æˆ‘å®¶æ—é‚Š å¥½å¥½åƒã„›
I've been coming here for their Banh Mi's for years. Every option is solid and the avocado shake is addictive!
Hole in a wall, a gem in this parts of 8th Ave. Quick and delicious banh mi and available early in the morning. Yum! I need to go back and see if they have pho also early in the AM ğŸ˜‹
Kind staff, fresh Vietnamese coffee, great value, cash only

Edit: came back for the food. Excellent banh mi #1. The bread is perfect, not too crispy or soft. Less crumbs and messy than other places. I would get very spicy next time. The #1 has 3 kinds of meats pate, ham, and BBQ pork. You can taste every ingredient. Not a fan of the fried spring rolls or the shrimp crepe.

Very good Viet coffee. Lots of locals come here. Will be back for hot chocolate. The summer rolls is only $6 for 3.

No frills Vietnamese sandwich and light take-out spot, but donâ€™t let that stop you from trying it out. This place is truly a gem. I go 45 mins out of my way for the BÃ¡nh bÃ¨o here and am happy to do so. Really feels like a place youâ€™d find in Westminster or sgv
Unreal. The best vegetarian banh mi (egg) Iâ€™ve ever had! The iced lemon tea is very refreshing too
It's a cool place, not bad for its area at all. Worth the try. If you never had Viet Sandwich, this place isn't bad. I would recommend this location. Give them a try.
Seriously the best banh mi in New York.

There is not much filing compare some some other shops but the flavor is good . There are a few tables but lots of a lot of aunties  and uncles just hanging out there so I had to take my sandwich togo
Excellent sandwiches combined with a very friendly service. A must try
ä¸œè¥¿è¿˜ä¸é”™å°±æ˜¯ï¼Œä¸€ç¾¤è€å¥³äººæ€åº¦éå¸¸å·®ï¼Œæœ‰å‡ å¥ä¸çŸ¥é“æ˜¯å¹¿ä¸œè¯è¿˜æ˜¯è¶Šè¯­ï¼Œå¬ä¸å¤ªæ˜ç™½ä¸€ç¾¤å¥³äººåœ¨é‚£è¾¹ç¬‘ã€‚

Service was fast and there wasnâ€™t a lot of people when I went so there was a lot of space. I order the grilled pork banh mi for 8 dollars which is very reasonable considering the size and flavors. The bread (assuming baguette) is nice and crispy exterior with a chewy interior. But it starts to cut the side of your mouth and makes it dry. The fillings flavors were very harmonized and well balanced but to have all of them together you gotta take a big bite because the meat is all the way inside while cilantro is in the outer layer. The flavors are very rich and have that sweet and sour taste in the sauce for the meat. Meat is also tender and is given in a fair amount. The vegetables are very fresh and the pepper gives it that extra spice which brings everything together. I believe the vegetables like cucumber may be pickled because the overall flavors are complex and deep. Closing statement: Bringing your own drink can help quench the dryness that the bread will give you.

Another cheap eat rec in 8 Avenue, Brooklyn. Ba XuyÃªn is a neighborhood favorite for affordable and homey vietnamese food. The shop is operated by some vietnamese aunties, serving a variety of banh mi, authentic street snacks and fruit shakes.

Iâ€™ve already been there at least three times whenever Iâ€™m craving for banh mi or feeling broke.

ï¼ŠBanh Mi Pate Thit Nguoi (Combination #1)
Banh mi is priced up to $8 in good portion size and hearty fillings. Every banh mi has a base of cucumber, cilantro, pickled carrots and green pepper. My go-to banh mi order is the bestselling combination #1. It has ham, pork, pork teriyaki & BBQ with patÃ© and butter. It is so filling that I can get two meals out of it.

ï¼ŠJackfruit Shake
I canâ€™t leave this place without getting their milkshake. They blend actual fruits into the shakes, giving it a natural and sweet flavor. They have tropical fruit flavors like lychee, taro, papaya and durian. I heard good things about their avocado shake, but I always stick to my favorite jackfruit shake.

I always love supporting the local shops This particular restaurant used to have two different locations they used to have a location right on 7th avenue 61st between 60th Street I've been supporting them for 20 years. Compare to how they make the sandwiches back then to now they skimp on so many things being partial Vietnamese, I can accept the fact that New York City banh mi uses Italians heroes rather than a baguette. myself You have put a sufficient around a meat they put like a thin slice of each oh I taste now is vegetable and bread they don't even take out the inside of the bread anymore like they used to. They stop giving the barbecue meat nem nuog A long time ago now they are skimping on the meat portions, I'm upset I can no longer come here and enjoy the sandwich like I used to. That old lady boss walks away when I tell them I know how your sandwich is used to taste compared to how it tastes now.

I finally did it. I found the best Banh Mi in the city.

The Banh Mi here have the perfect combination of subtle yet delicious flavors, fresh ingredients, and the PERFECT bread.

In my opinion, the bread is one of the crucial components of the Banh Mi. I have had many delicious Banh Mi with good, fresh ingredients that have been ruined by chewy bread, stale bread, or overly â€œAmericanâ€ sub bread. This bread has an excellent outer crispiness with a soft warm interior. The balance of meat to vegetables to sauce is perfect. I will come back here continuously as long as I live in the city.

It is also cash only! And the Banh Mi was $8. An amazing deal.

Delicious food, fast service and friendly staff. This is my third time since finding them last week. Canâ€™t recommend them enough and great value for money.
Iâ€™ve had the number one, the tuna bahn mi, the escargot and fried noodles. Theâ€¦

My favorite Vietnamese sandwich spot for many many years. A little gem! Always those kind ladies there, service and quality of the food never changed! The butter hero itâ€™s a heaven,I usually choose that or the fresh veggie sandwich. Vietnamese coffee very delicious if you like a stronger one. They have couple of tables you can seat down and eat there. Usually I just pick up and take it to go..If we are in Brooklyn my family always pick up here something to eat.

The banh mi here is amazing. The contrast between the crunchy baguette, creamy pate, pickled veggies, and spicy peppers creates a delightful bite. It's a family-run business, so ordering can become a bit chaotic when the line gets long, as there's no defined queue.

Most authentic banh mi in NYC. Only thing that can be made more authentic is the bread. Itâ€™s good but itâ€™s not the best ever. A little too dense.

Order the #1

I always buy the #6 Chicken Sandwich, is very delicious, fresh and light $7.50 and $6 for the cake pandan flavor? Will be wonderful with ice cream. I literally walk 21min back and forth for this because Bus in 8ave is so scarce sometimes. It worth my walk and even today that was so hot. I call for pick-up â˜ºï¸

amazing spot for banh mi! i got #9 grilled chicken for $8
the baguette is perfectly soft yet crunchy, warm, and the ratio of meat to veg is perfect and the flavors harmonize so well

Cheap and bare-bones restaurant, with quick service. The sandwiches are large and delicious. The vegetables are perfectly pickled, and the meats are flavorful without being overpowering. The bread is also soft enough to bite but hearty enough not to buckle under the weight of all the ingredients. I also tried the avocado shake, which was thick and creamy and had a hint of avocado flavor to balance the sweetness.

Iâ€™ve eaten a fair number of banh mi sandwiches across Vietnam, and at most of the decent shops in NYCâ€¦and I can confidently say that Ba Xuyen wins for the best and most authentic banh mi sandwich in all of NYC. It is very much worth the trip to Sunset Park, and is a must have if youâ€™re in the neighborhood. The baguettes that they use for the sandwiches are just heavenly fresh and crispy - so good that they retain their freshness for the next 1-2 days (so Iâ€™ll buy a few sandwiches to eat as my lunch the next day). The price canâ€™t be beat â€” most sandwiches run from $6-7 each, and they are generous with portions and use fresh ingredients. I highly recommend #1 for the classic combination banh mi sandwich, and my wife loves #9 for the grilled chicken banh mi. The shop is very unassuming and the ladies preparing sandwiches behind the window are brisk but friendly, and they speak English. Tip them well and keep supporting this local gem. Businesses like these are what make NYC the greatest city to live in.

Here offers the best Vietnamese coffee according to my husband. I also like their Vietnamese sandwiches.  It's a good place to buy take out food but keep in mind eating the sandwiches fresh is the key! The restaurant do offer some tables and seats but obvious it's not a dine in restaurant and no one serves you.

Wow delicious!!  Been here a couple of time and itâ€™s tasty, consistent, well priced, with smiley service (which isnâ€™t always the case on 8th).  Only a couple of tables so better to take out.  Also different Vietnamese snacks and already prepared foods.  The baguette sandwiches are a wonderful blending of French and Vietnamese flavors.  Great lunch place, will be back!
Food is great and close to tradition. The seating is very limited (3-4 tables with about 10 chairs total). Cash only.

Came here half an hour before closing to grab some banh mi. I ordered their number one with spicy while my sister got their number eight. The two ladies working here were very nice and they made the sandwiches and my thai milk tea very quickly ğŸ™‚.
The bread for the sandwiches were nice and crispy and warm/hot. The number one comes with different cuts of vietnamese hams, some grilled pork, cucumber, parsley, and pickled carrots&turnip. The number eight was the same but without the ham cuts. The "spicy" in my sandwich, or the jalapeno pepper slices, were somewhat spicy. (Guess it depends on ur luck in terms of getting spicy pepper versus non spicy ones lol)
Other than that they have around 6 tables for seating and other types of snacks available for sale too, like durian mung bean cake... etc. Very casual place to grab a quick meal.
Overall, it was a good experience 0w0. I probably will visit this place again ğŸ‘.
Been coming here for years now. This place makes a killer banh mi sandwich and ice coffee. My two combo orders when I visit. Also, their grilled pork & shredded pork with rice is good as well.

This place used to serve very good Banh Mi, but after inflation, the prices went up while the quality went down hill. Paying $7.50 for a Banh Mi with such a small amount of meat and veggies is excessively overpriced. I recommend trying other places that offer better Banh mi. Avoid this place if possible.
My most favorite place for BÃ¡nh mÃ¬ ğŸ˜‹ it taste amazing, and they have many options to try, but my fav is #1. The staff are super kind and friendly and really make you feel like family.
Always my go-to spot for bahn mi. I still believe this is the best bahn mi place in NYC. The ladies are always super nice and quick. 2023 pricing ~ $8.50

Worse Banh Mi sandwich I've ever ate. Pate had a dry texture and they use some kind of watery Mayonnaise instead of lard.  And the bread was TOO hard! (At least make it hard on the outside and soft on the inside, but no it's hard throughâ€¦

Tasty bahn mi. I got the ham and pate one. All the ingredients worked well together and I gobbeled it into my gullet. The avocado shake really brings out the refreshing parts of an avocado and is delicious.
cash only; some tables inside; you can order in english, mandarin, or cantonese and im assuming probably also vietnamese.â€¦

Got the #1 from their sandwich menu & brought it home to eat. The bread was toasted nicely, just enough crunch for that nice bite, but soft enough so that your gums aren't ripped to shreds. Good balance of ingredients and not overlyâ€¦
Absolutely phenomenal sandwich and the cold drink was unbelievable (honeydew milk). Made with so much love that it satisfies instantly. Amazing local business.
